title: What is the main purpose of TypeScript?

options.a: A way to control access to your TypeScript application
options.b: To add static typing to JavaScript and make it more robust
options.c: A technique for managing component dependencies and lifecycle

title: How do you declare a variable with a specific type in TypeScript?

options.c: Using type annotations after the variable name
options.d: TypeScript does not support variable types

title: What is the 'any' type in TypeScript?

options.a: A type that represents any object
options.b: A type that should be avoided in favor of more specific types
options.c: A type that enforces strict type checking

A special kind of declaration that can be attached to classes, methods, and properties
